info.name: fetch
info.description:
Fetch a resource from the internet

This command will fetch a resource from the internet and print the response.
info.summary: Fetch a resource from the internet

commands.name: fetch
commands.description:
Fetch a resource from the internet

This command will fetch a resource from the internet and print the response.
commands.summary: Fetch a resource from the internet

commands.name: completion
commands.description:
Generate an autocompletion script for fetch in the specified shell.
See each sub-command's help for details on how to use the generated script.
commands.summary: Generate an autocompletion script for the specified shell

commands.name: bash
commands.description:
Generate the autocompletion script for the bash shell.

This script depends on the 'bash-completion' package.
If it is not installed already, you can install it via your OS's package manager.

To load completions in your current shell session:
$ source <(fetch completion bash)

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

Linux:
  $ fetch completion bash > /etc/bash_completion.d/fetch
  
MacOS:
  $ fetch completion bash > /usr/local/etc/bash_completion.d/fetch

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.
commands.summary: Generate an autocompletion script for the bash shell

commands.name: fish
commands.description:
Generate the autocompletion script for the fish shell.

To load completions in your current shell session:
$ fetch completion fish | source

To load completions for every new session, execute once:
$ fetch completion fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/fetch.fish

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.
commands.summary: Generate an autocompletion script for the fish shell

commands.description: Show help for a completion command
commands.summary: Show help for a completion command

arguments.description: The command to read help for
arguments.summary: The command to read help for

flags.name: all
flags.description: Show all commands, including hidden ones
flags.summary: Show all commands, including hidden ones

commands.name: zsh
commands.description:
Generate the autocompletion script for the zsh shell.

If shell completion is not already enabled in your environment you will need
to enable it.  You can execute the following once:

$ echo "autoload -U compinit; compinit" >> ~/.zshrc

To load completions for every new session, execute once:

# Linux:
$ fetch completion zsh > "${fpath[1]}/_fetch"

# macOS:
$ fetch completion zsh > /usr/local/share/zsh/site-functions/_fetch

# Oh My Zsh
$ fetch completion zsh > ~/.oh-my-zsh/completions/_fetch

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.
commands.summary: Generate an autocompletion script for the zsh shell
